newsitem.title: INDIA: India rupee rate more or less correct - Chidambaram.
newsitem.headline: India rupee rate more or less correct - Chidambaram.

text.p: Indian Finance Minister Palaniappan Chidambaram said on Wednesday that the real exchange rate of the rupee currently is more or less correct.
India does not expect its opposition to a global nuclear test ban treaty to damage economic relations with the rest of the world, Chidambaram said.
"I have been assured we don't expect any economic fallout and hope there would not be any economic fallout," Chidambaram told reporters in the Indian capital.
Chidambaram told reporters the government was in no hurry to make the rupee fully convertible as an immediate move in that direction could lead to a short-run capital flight out of India.

"It is not our intention to make the rupee weaker or stronger. We want the rupee to reflect the fundamentals of the economy," he said."The real effective rupee exchange rate today is more or less correct."
